result.execSummary:
All charges against Troy M. Myers in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Troy M. Myers is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Troy M. Myers

Clerk: Amy. 
Case called:  2:10 p.m. 

State appears by ADA Cody Marschall.  Defendant appears in custody from MCJ via video with Atty Trevor Peterson.    

Date and time set for initial appearance. VRCW.  
Reading Waived.  Reserve Jurisdiction. 
PLEA: Not guilty. 

COURT ORDERS: $150.00 signature bond.  

CONDITIONS: 
- Absolute sobriety from and no possession of controlled substances except prescriptions taken as prescribed.  
- No possession of drug paraphernalia. 
- Report to ATTIC Corrections Services within one business day of release.  Comply with pretrial monitoring through ATTIC Correctional Services at Level 1 supervision with possible drug testing as determined by agency screening.  

JPTC: 1/31/22 at 9:30 a.m. 
FPT: 4/27/22 at 9:30 a.m. 
JT: 5/24/22 at 9:00 a.m.
